comments.text:
I tried again with mail.imap.expunge_threshold_number=2, but it didn't help to remove 3 mails completely from the IMAP server :-(

Only "Empty Trash" triggers TB to send the EXPUNGE command, but this doesn't help if one wants to only partially free the Trash.

I additionally think, it's an error that "View/Not Deleted" isn't available and "View/All" doesn't display the delete marked messages.

If "Move to trash" delete model is configured, IMO mail.imap.expunge_after_delete=true should be set automatically, because "UnDo Delete" could still remain to work properly on normal folders using the copy from the trash folder.
With default of mail.imap.expunge_threshold_number=20, server activity should be enough prevented from overload.

comments.text:
FYI.

Global setting of mail.imap.expunge_after_delete=true is saved in global variable of gExpungeAfterDelete. And gExpungeAfterDelete is used at following step only.
> http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2898
> 2854       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineCopy:
> 2855       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineMove:
> 2898               if (gExpungeAfterDelete && storeSuccessful) Expunge();
> http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2941
> 2913       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineCopy:
> 2914       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineMove:
> 2941                   if (gExpungeAfterDelete) Expunge();

In both case, expunge is issued only "after Copy or Move" && gExpungeAfterDelete==true(mail.imap.expunge_after_delete==true).
i.e.
- If "Just mark as deleted" or "Remove immediately"(there is no folder of special
  attribute of "Trash"), or "Shift+Delete",
  "delete mail" is not "Copy nor Move", so expunge is not issued.
- If "delete mail at trash folder" with "Move to trash" model,
  it's not "Copy nor Move". It's same as Shift+Delete(==delete without copy/move).
  So expunge is not issued by mail.imap.expunge_after_delete==true.

When nsImapOnlineCopy: or nsImapOnlineMove:, if server supports MOVE extension, Tb uses MOVE command upon "Move mail to other Mbox of same IMAP account".
And "delete mail at Mbox of the IMAP server(non trash)" is "move mail in the Mbox at server to trash folder" when "Move to trash" model.
Because MOVE command is used, there is no neeed to issue EXPUNGE for the deleted mail(moved to trash), expunge command is not issued after delete mail even when mail.imap.expunge_after_delete==true.

I don't know this is intentional or by design(because copy of deleted mail is not kept upon "delete mail at trash folder", "issuing expunge" means "no way to undelete", so it's dangerous, then safe way is chosen.)

Anyway, confirming.

(In reply to WADA from comment #5)
> FYI.
Thanks for the effort, linking and extracting the code :-)

I think, you have overseen 2 essential statements:
> > http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2898
> > 2854       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineCopy:
> > 2855       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineMove:
  > 2889..2892       if (nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineMove && !kHasMoveCapability)
  > 2894               Store(messageIdString, "+FLAGS (\\Deleted \\Seen)", bMessageIdsAreUids);
> > 2898               if (gExpungeAfterDelete && storeSuccessful)  Expunge();
This is "Move to *OFFLINE*Folder", so "server supports MOVE" doesn't matter:
> > http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2941
> > 2913       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineCopy:
> > 2914       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineMove:
  > 2918           if (NS_SUCCEEDED)
  > 2934..2935         if (nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineMove)
  > 2937                 Store(messageIdString, "+FLAGS (\\Deleted \\Seen)", bMessageIdsAreUids);
  > 2938                 if (storeSuccessful)
> > 2941                   if (gExpungeAfterDelete) Expunge();

So effectively it is:
> http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2854
>       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineCopy:
>           ProcessStatusUponServerResponse(); // would be nice code cleanup ;-)
>                   // redundancy could be moved before the switch statement !
>           break;
>       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineMove:
>           ProcessStatusUponServerResponse();
>           if (!kHasMoveCapability)
>             Store(messageIdString, "+FLAGS (\\Deleted \\Seen)", bMessageIdsAreUids);
>             if (gExpungeAfterDelete && storeSuccessful)  Expunge();
>           break;
> http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mailnews/imap/src/nsImapProtocol.cpp#2913
>       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineCopy:
>           ProcessStatusUponServerResponse();
>           break;
>       case nsIImapUrl::nsImapOnlineToOfflineMove:
>           ProcessStatusUponServerResponse();
>           if (NS_SUCCEEDED)
>             Store(messageIdString, "+FLAGS (\\Deleted \\Seen)", bMessageIdsAreUids);
>             if (storeSuccessful && gExpungeAfterDelete)  Expunge();
>           break;

> In both case, expunge is issued only "after Copy or Move" ...
No, but:
"mark as deleted" is issued only after
  "OnlineMove && !kHasMoveCapability". \\ even if real COPY failed, IMO bug !!!
  "OnlineToOfflineMove && Copy==successful". \\ OK !!!
"expunge" is issued only after
  "MarkDeleted==successful && gExpungeAfterDelete==true".

In fact, mail.imap.expunge_after_delete
     is: mail.imap.expunge_after_copy_instead_move
as it is not effective on "Just mark as deleted" and "Delete immediately" model, but it seems to be effective on normal "Move from A to B" if server !kHasMoveCapability, which has nothing to do with "Delete".
I'm not sure what will happen after Shift+Delete on "Just mark as deleted" model?

> - If "delete mail at trash folder" with "Move to trash" model,
>   it's not "Copy nor Move". It's same as Shift+Delete(==delete without
> copy/move).
>   So expunge is not issued by mail.imap.expunge_after_delete==true.
On any file manager I know, Shift+Delete = Expunge, so please consider expunge on Shift+Delete and any Move model if "server !kHasMoveCapability" as default. As I said, I could chum up with a non-default property like never_expunge_after_marked_delete_or_copy_instead_move or never_expunge_after_delete_or_move or just never_expunge_automatically or never_expunge_silently.

> I don't know this is intentional or by design(because copy of deleted mail
> is not kept upon "delete mail at trash folder", "issuing expunge" means "no
> way to undelete", so it's dangerous, then safe way is chosen.)
Well, this behaviour is well-known from most applications, but for normal delete also most applications (TB too) provide "Delete to Trash" as default, so this seems to be consensus to be SAFE enough.
And deleting in/at Trash seems to be consensus as freeing resources.
